DATA SOURCE DESCRIPTIONS ========================
BURATTI-1997 ------------ Taken from ENCYCLOPEDIA OF PLANETARY SCIENCES entry entitled SATELLITE, NATURAL [BURATTI1997].
CUNNINGHAM-1997 --------------- Taken from ENCYCLOPEDIA OF PLANETARY SCIENCES entry entitled TITAN [CUNNINGHAM1997].
IAU-1994 -------- Taken or derived from REPORT OF THE IAU/IAG/COSPAR WORKING GROUP ON CARTOGRAPHIC COORDINATES AND ROTATIONAL ELEMENTS OF THE PLANETS AND SATELLITES: 1994 [DAVIESETAL1996A]. Given mean radius (MR), equatorial radius (ER), and polar radius (PR), then:
MR = ER = PR A_AXIS_RADIUS = ER B_AXIS_RADIUS = ER C_AXIS_RADIUS = ER FLATTENING = (ER - PR)/ER
NAIF-1997 --------- Taken from the NAIF 1997 Planetary Constants Kernel PCK00006.TPC, itself based on IAU-1994 (see above). In the NAIF file, three-element vectors [constant term, linear coefficient for Julian centuries since the standard epoch (J2000), and a third term which NAIF sets to 0] give the pole right ascension and declination. Only the constant term is retained here.
